turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Momma told ya not to speak to strangers, huh?  Hey!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Don't touch me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm not gonna hurt you. I just wanna talk.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Okay then...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well... you're causin' trouble, you know that?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm causing trouble?! You're a pain in the butt! You newshounds've been after me and my folks ever since I won that dumb contest. I'm just sixteen, you know? Who the hell cares what I think?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Not me. But other people seem to.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah. Well if you didn't put it in the papers -- nobody'd even know about it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Now wait a minute, sweetie. Do I look like a newshound to you?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No... Actually, you look more like a cop.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'll... take your word for it. So who are you, then?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Harry York. I work for Martoni Kaminski, he's running for Congress here.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh yeah! I saw you in the newsreel!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, well --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You know, my Dad's done some work for Kaminski...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Now you're catchin' on. Don't wanna get your Daddy in hot water, do you?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Whattaya mean?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well... see the papers've got us pegged as pinkos, then you come along, the friendly neighborhood atheist --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But I'm not. The newspapers're --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Right again. You're no more an atheist than my man's a Red, but what they're doin', see, they're addin' up their version of your ideas with their version of ours. Could look bad for your Daddy.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah. Could look bad for you and Kaminski too, I guess.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sure don't talk like you're sixteen.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well aren't you the smoothie. Now you're going to ask for my number, I suppose.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I suppose not. Gotta ask you this, though: for all our sakes, you better keep your trap shut.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well... I'll give it a try, Mr. York.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Harry.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Harry.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Hi, Harry. Did you see the play?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You think I'd miss it?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well? What'd you think?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I just wanted to see how you looked.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: How'd I look?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Enh.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Don't be a rat, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You looked okay.  Joint's pretty dead. How 'bout I take you home?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Honest. When you were up there, you were really... there, know what I mean? Everyone else looked stupid.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't know... I did... feel different... Alive.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah, it's a gift. You gotta do something with it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah, but if I win this trip, Mama'll kill me. She hates Russians. I do want to go, though... to New York, especially... but I wanted to do it...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Quietly.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're not the quiet type, Frances.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You know, my old man was an inventor. Spent his whole life down in the basement trying to design transcontinental underground railroads, stuff like that. Well, I was supposed to be his partner. When I told him the smell of his workshop made me sick, I thought he was going to die right there.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What happened to him?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He retired to Florida... made a killing in vending machines.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I kick myself sometimes, but the thing is, I would have been miserable living his life.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...So you think I should go.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sure. Try this acting thing. You can make good money at it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't know, Harry. I... I want so many...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You don't know what you want.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well... don't you think it's up to me to...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Come on, Harry. This is America, land of the free.  I thought we might go skinny dipping.  For starters.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How ya doin', Farmer?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Me? Look at you! What're you doing in Hollywood?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Came to get a tan.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Not bad. But come on, Harry; what's the real reason?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Kaminski.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah, I read about that. Terrible business, suicide.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Since when do you believe the papers? They killed him, kid.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: They killed him. They threw him out that window.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh no...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Eight stories.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yup. Poor bastard lay there on the sidewalk and he couldn't die. Too god damn much heart. He just didn't want to die.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But... but why, Harry...? Why'd they do it?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: He wouldn't play ball. What can I tell ya... it's done.  Anyway, I didn't want to be next, so I skipped town; came down here to work for some big-wig. Tail and nail job.  I'm sort of a non-gentleman's non- gentleman.  How d'ya like the camouflage?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You jackass!  C'mon, let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Not bad. It was slow at first, but I'm doing bits now.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I always told ya, Frances. You got real ability.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I know what ability you're interested in.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey, I'm a man, aren't I? Whattaya say we have dinner, then maybe head out to the beach, rub some of this tan off each other.  For old time's sake.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Harry... I met someone.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah? What is he -- muscleman? Lifeguard?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Serious, huh?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey that's great, Farmer, just great.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Shit. I meant the other way around.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well, the studio told me not to.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Is that why you did it?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Who ever thought they'd be right for once? Jesus, Harry... it's a zoo back there --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're telling me.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dick... and my mother! She acts like she's on Mars or something --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, she's back to earth now. They're all pretty huffed up about your leaving. I think you better go back, kid.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You know, the funny thing is: it's not a great movie. I mean it could've been, but they screwed it up, gave it a happy ending. And all my friends, I know they're going to smile and say they loved it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: If they say they love it, they'll probably love it. Not everybody lies, you know?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, they don't, do they?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances, you're a movie star now. If you give them what they want, you can get anything.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't have what they want, Harry.  Harry, will you tell me something? How can I keep making movies when people in the streets are starving?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Some people starve, kid. Until we can do something about it, they might as well see a movie. Makes 'em feel better.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But I don't want to be like that. I want to do something...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What're you gonna do, waste your talent? Why not use it to make something worthwhile. You can do that, you know?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah, if I don't make too big an ass of myself.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Tell you what. Let's ditch the limo. Let me drive you up to that red carpet in my beat up Chevy.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: The hell you will, Harry York.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Come on, Cinderella, your pumpkin awaits.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Don't start, Farmer.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It's midnight, Harry. My glittering raiments are dissolving.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: The chauffeur. He's watching.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: He deserves a show. He missed the movie.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm serious, Frances. This is important.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Harry? Harry, where are you?!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Jesus, Frances, how'd you find me?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I called your god-damned office! I want you to kill him, Harry. You'll do that for me, won't you? I loved him, I loved him... that bastard.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Calm down, Frances.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Don't tell me what to do, just give me his head on a platter!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Two lines! Two fucking lines! 'My wife returns from Europe tomorrow. I can't see you any more.' Just like that!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Harry, I hate being in love. I don't ever want to be in love again. I just hate it!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: How the hell do you find me anyway?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Animal magnetism!  No ginger beer. What's this red stuff?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What's left of my blood.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Think I'll have a glass.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Help yourself. Everyone else has.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Nice joint. Can you afford it?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Nope. The studio pays. Thank you, Harry.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What for?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: For not chopping off his head and serving it to me on a platter.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, I would have, you know? I just didn't know how to cook it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Six months' probation...? You gotta learn when to do battle, Farmer. You're not going to win many bouts with 200 pound cops.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I took the early rounds.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'll bet.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't know. It hurts, Harry. Some things, no matter what you do with them, they just hurt.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: So you drink, and you fight with a cop...?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah, and you look at people and you wonder who the hell they are, what's going on inside their heads. Sometimes you can hear it, like a buzzing, the things that happen in their heads. And you wonder: does anybody ever love anybody, really?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Beats me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey look, I got some business down in San Diego. Whattaya say you come with me, stay a few days?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, Harry, I can't --

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You're coming.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I just wanted to be part of something... one thing, one play or one movie, something that was really fine... memorable. And I could say: I did that, I made something good.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well... to get a crack at something good, you gotta earn it, you gotta climb the ladder first. So you do, you work hard, and all these people behind you are pushing you up, shouting you on. And then one day you realize you are, you're at the top... and there's nothing there. And you look behind you and there's no one below. You're just left there all alone... swaying in the god-damned breeze.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Take a walk, pal.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Who said I was a lady?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh my God, I look awful.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You've looked a whole lot better. C'mon.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Evening, gorgeous.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: That sure looks like fun...  You know how long it's been since I was behind the wheel?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Forget it, Frances. You're not driving.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Have I told you how mean you're turning, York?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Where are we, mean man?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Couple hours from Idaho. We'll cut across to Montana. I've got friends there with a ranch.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I should've known...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: This is another one of your schemes to get me off alone...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...Take advantage of me.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't think I'd be much good in a war...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Whattaya think you're in now?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't know. Not a war exactly. It's more a... a misapprehension maybe...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: A misunderstanding, people taking the wrong meaning from things. I wasn't declaring war, Harry. I was just saying my prayers.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Harry, I have to go home. I have to talk to Mama.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances, you're fulla drugs. You don't know what you're saying. Who do you think put you into Meadow Wood? Your mother thinks you're crazy and she'll keep on thinking it as long as it suits her.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, she just didn't want me going to jail, that's all.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah? She's a shark, Frances. I'm not taking you there, and that's that!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You know something, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I guess.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Aside from meanness, you're almost perfect. There's only one other thing wrong with you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You can't drink.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Ohhh, that's lousy Scotch!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey! Another shot for the lady and a double for me!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What a man!

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey, you're a good quarter-horse, kid, but you can't go a route of ground.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: To quarter-horses.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No. To thoroughbreds.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Why are you always leaving me, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You should stickaround sometimes. Look out for me.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Look, Frances, I'm only gonna ask this one time. I mean it. I swear after this, I'll never ask again: Will you marry me?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I know a thing or two about marriage. You... you understand me more than anyone, Harry... maybe even more than Mama. But... you're too important to me. I'd fail you. I don't know how or why, but I would. And that's a chance I just can't take. Do you understand?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well... I'll act like I do until I do.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: There's just one more thing.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Will you marry me?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It's not too late to keep going, up to Vancouver? Be the smartest thing.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thanks, Harry, really, but... I can't explain it. She's my mother. She's just... I can't give up on her that easy.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You give up on her?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah. It's just... something I gotta do, I guess.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances, You're crazy.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I know. Don't tell anyone.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Anyway... if you need me...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I got your number, Mister Man.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances! Frances!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Who?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Frances, it's me, Harry?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...Touch me again and I'll kill you, you pig.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I love you, Harry. I love you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I love you too, Frances.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Where to?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh Harry...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: This is it, kid. This is our chance. When you got a chance, you better take it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah. I don't know.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You don't need to screw around anymore. You don't need Dwayne Steele or Odets or your mother. You need me.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I know, but... There were so many people in there, Harry. Every time I turned around someone was pressing against me... watching, looking over my shoulder, touching me, grabbing, sticking things into me. When I feel somebody near me now... anybody... my skin starts to crawl.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Been a lot of years, you know. A long time waiting. For what? End up feeling like a sap.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh please, Harry... don't even think it. You're the only person who ever... It's just... Can't you wait for me?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yes you do. If you love me you can wait, right? A month, six months, whatever it takes.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Right. Except... time has a way of --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, Harry, it's not time, it's us. You and me. And I'm telling you now that I'll come to you, okay? I'll find you. I will.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I hope so, Frances.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: C'mere. I want to talk to you.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh. Why, Harry York. How nice to see you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How... how ya doin', Farmer?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Fine, thank you. Did you watch the show?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Sure I did, that's why I'm here.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: How did I look?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, you...  ...ennh.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well... you're looking well.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I got a new car. Only it's red. Did you know Mama died?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah, I heard about that.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dad, too. I sold the house. I'm a faceless sinner, Harry...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Why do you say that?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'd ask you to take me home, but I'm a faceless sinner.  ...You smell good, Harry. Familiar, you know? I'd ask you to take me home, but...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It's going to be slow from now on. Do you know what I mean, Harry?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm not sure.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Very slow.  But we're not going to stop, are we?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, we're not.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Goodbye, Harry. It was very good to see you again.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yes. Would you like me to walk a little way with you?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: That would be okay.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Just a little way.

turns.speaker: HITCHHIKER
turns.text: Pretty morning.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It's always beautiful at this time. Peaceful...

turns.speaker: HITCHHIKER
turns.text: And no people.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: HITCHHIKER
turns.text: Where you goin'?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Wherever they're going, I'm going.

turns.speaker: HITCHHIKER
turns.text: Yeah, I know what that's like... Where you been?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well, I was picking fruit with some migrant workers until...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HITCHHIKER
turns.text: What'd you do?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You know, I've never been able to figure that out.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Shit!

turns.speaker: HITCHHIKER
turns.text: Run!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: ...Is that not true?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Who's writing this guy's lines?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Answer the question! Have you driven a car since you were placed on probation?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, I couldn't get my hands on one.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Have you reported to your Probation Officer as directed?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I never saw him. Why didn't he show up?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Did you expect him to look you up?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Why, certainly. I wanted to get a peek at his face...

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: You're on your way to a contempt citation, young lady.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: That's fine with me...  Get it? Fine. A fine! Hey c'mon, c'mon, what is this, an audience or a jury?

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Miss Farmer, is it true you fought with the policeman who arrested you last night?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Sure it's true. I was fighting for my country as well as myself.

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Miss Farmer, you were advised at the last hearing that if you took one drink of liquor or failed to be a law-abiding citizen --

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: Miss Farmer! In light of your flagrant disregard for the conditions of your probation, coupled with the unwarranted assault on the Plaintiff here... I am forced to order you to begin serving a sentence of 180 days in the County Jail.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Fine!

turns.speaker: JUDGE
turns.text: You are a deeply troubled young lady... I only hope you change your course before it's too late.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What happened? Who're you?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: Who're you?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I live here.

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: You're Farmer? Oh... Well, look, they took your stuff out. Moved it to some hotel, I think.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: MAN
turns.text: I'm preparin' it for the next tenant, he's coming in tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: And what's the title of this seduc... assault?

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: 'Golden Boy.'

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: That's me, Clifford.

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: I know, but I'm not seeing it. It's there, Frances, the fire is there, but it's not coming through. You're lazy --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm not!

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: Yes, you win them, you bring them into your heart, touch them, but you don't set them on fire!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: But I want to. I'm trying!

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: I need an incendiary! An arsonist!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Then show me! That's what I'm here for, to learn, to grow!

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: Good. Then it's very simple. You have to stop being afraid, Frances. It's in you.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: 'But how do I know you love me?'

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: Your big speech?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: 'How do I know it's true? You'll get to be the champ. They'll all want you, all the girls! But I don't care. I've been undersea a long time. When they'd put their hands on me I used to say, "This isn't it! This isn't what I mean!" It's been a mysterious world for me! But Joe, I think you're it! I don't know why, I think you're it. Take me home with you.'

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: I already have.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: How's it sound?

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: The speech? Real good.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You think I got it?

turns.speaker: ODETS
turns.text: You got it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yeah. Yeah, tonight I think I got it.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Mama...

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I'm not hungry. You two just enjoy yourselves. After all, this is a celebration.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Don't listen to him, little sister. When you're proud of what you are, you don't refuse the label, understand?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yes, Ma.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: And you... should be proud. You won that contest and made a name for yourself.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: But they're using you!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh Ma, they're not using me. It's just a chance to travel, see things. Besides, it's the only way I can get to New York.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I'll pay your way to New York. I'll work, I'll slave. I'll sell my vegetables to the truck farmers, or --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh, Mama, don't you understand?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It isn't in your hands, Mama. It's my life.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Yes, but important people are concerned about this. Judge Hillier spoke to Alma Styles --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I don't care.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: ...You will.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It's okay.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Smile, little sister, smile.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: It's alright now, little sister, everything's going to be just fine.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Mama, what's...

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Shhh, shhh. You're not going to jail, Frances. The Judge has put you under my care. I'll see you get the rest you need.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You're taking me home!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Tell them who I am! Tell them who I am!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Are you crazy? Unhand that woman! That's Amelia Earhart!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: And here's one from nice Mr. Zeiss. He says that...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Why are these all opened?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Well, they needed immediate answers, Frances. It's good manners and good sense. You shouldn't be bothering yourself with these right now.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Then why did you bring them?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: It's your fan mail, little sister.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You kill me, Mama.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Go on...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Well, who have we here...?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Frances, you remember my lawyer, Alma Styles?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh Mama, I'm so... tired of that song.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Please. I want you to. It would make me so happy.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I think I need a little air.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: What's wrong?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Nothing. I think I'll just go out for awhile.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: For a walk, Mama. Just a walk.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: How long will you be?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Not long.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I'll have lunch ready by one.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'll be back.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: At one. Promise?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Say you promise.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I promise I'll... I promise, Mama.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You know, the surest way to lose an appetite, is to drink, little sister.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yes, Mama.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I don't want you drinking, Frances.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yes, Mama.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm back, Mama.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Oh Frances, do I have news for you! Guess who --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Wait, Mama, wait. I have something to tell you. I've decided... well... I'm not going to make movies anymore. I thought that's what I wanted, and I went after it with all my soul, the way you taught me, but I was miserable, Mama, and it nearly killed me. So now... now it's over. I want a different kind of life, something... simple. I want to live someplace quiet and peaceful... in the country maybe, and I'll have dogs and cats -- I feel so light suddenly, so clear for the first time in... It's going to be okay, Mama, I know it. And I love you.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Don't... talk crazy.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Mama...?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: They want you back! Your agent called today! Don't you understand? He's sending the scripts. He wants to fly up here in a week with the publicity people! Frances, you can't do this to your fans! Why, they've been praying for you all through this nightmare. You can't turn your back on them now! Look at this fan mail I've been answering!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Haven't you heard what I said?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I told him to come up! I told him you wanted to show them all that there's nothing wrong with you any more, that you're completely cured!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm not cured. I was never sick! They had no business putting me in there! My only responsibility is to myself now!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You... you selfish, selfish child. At least talk to him, hear what he has to say.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You want to throw it all away, is that it? You had everything, little sister. Beauty... a brilliant career... a wonderful husband. You were a movie star!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Mama, shut up!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: And now you're throwing everything away? You're gonna be a nobody! Nobody! You know what that's like?!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You... You'd send me back, wouldn't you? You would.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm going out!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You're not going anywhere!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yes, I am, and you can't stop me! You can't tell me what to do, mother. I'm a grown woman, and I can decide about my own life.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Frances!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Of course, she hasn't anything definite in mind.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No. No, it all depends on what offers I get.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Oh, just leave those things for now.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, Mama, I'll take care of it. I'll wash them in the morning.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: You know, little sister, I never resented you for refusing to see me in the... the hospital. I knew you had to manage on your own before you could come back.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Thank you for understanding, Mama.

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: Little sister, I don't want you to feel any rush to get back to work. I want you to rest... for a while anyway.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I will, I promise.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Do I go right away or do I have time to take a bath?

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I was hoping for a kind word, little sister.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You were hoping for a kind word?! You're my mother! You're supposed to nourish me! Support me!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: I have!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No! All you've done is try to break my spirit, try to turn me into you! But I'm not you, mother, and I never will be, and thank god for it!  That goes for you too! And frankly, I don't know how, with the two of you, I turned out as sane as I am --  Wait right there, gentlemen, I'll be with you in a minute... and believe me, I don't want to stay here one second longer than I have to!  But I've got to tell you, Lillian, that one day before you die, you will realize what you've done and hang your head in shame. In shame!

turns.speaker: LILLIAN
turns.text: But what --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No! You're not talking now. You listen. You can send me away, Lillian, you can pretend I'm crazy and pretend I'm still your little girl who can't take care of herself, but one thing you can't pretend anymore. You can't pretend I love you because I don't. I can't. Not after what you've done to me. Because you see... I'm still me... I'm trying real hard all this time to be me... and you, 'little sister', you haven't been any help at all.  Okay, boys, I'm ready.

turns.speaker: JUDGE HILLIER'S WIFE
turns.text: On behalf of the Seattle Ladies Club, as a token of our vast admiration --

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Excuse me.

turns.speaker: JUDGE HILLIER'S WIFE
turns.text: Yes...?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Don't I know you?

turns.speaker: JUDGE HILLIER'S WIFE
turns.text: I don't believe so.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Sure. You shouted at me in the auditorium when I read my essay.

turns.speaker: JUDGE HILLIER'S WIFE
turns.text: No, my dear. You must be mistaken.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh bullshit.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: I find these initial meetings to be much easier without the concerned relatives in attendance.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Am I supposed to say 'thank you'?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Thanks are hardly necessary.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Aw, shucks, ma'am. T'weren't nothin'.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: I'm glad to see you haven't lost your sense of humor.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: It ain't for lack of trying.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: So it seems. May we be serious for a moment?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Why, Doctor! We've only just met!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh! Are you really?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Among persons such as yourself, creative people under great stress, erratic behavior is not at all uncommon and certainly nothing to be ashamed of. It's just that the neuroses which fuel your talent can also generate certain character disabilities which...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Do you expect me, for one moment, to believe you have greater insight into my personality than I do?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Please sit down...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You may discuss my predicament, Doctor. You may discuss it with anyone you like, but not with me. I'm not interested. I can solve my problems without recourse to a veternarian.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Besides, I don't want to be what you want to make me.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: And what's that?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Normal. Average.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: All right. Will you please sit down now?  Symington says.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: ...Did you really say that?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Just a little joke, Miss Farmer.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: This whole thing is a joke!

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Stay calm, please.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, you stay calm, Doctor! But you're finding that difficult, aren't you?  Why, are you attracted to me? Perhaps later, in some of our more intimate sessions... after we know each other a little better...  and you've torn my personality to shreds, and I'm weeping and vulnerable...  then you'll really get your kicks, won't you, "Doctor?"

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: I'll have someone show you to your room.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh, that's good, very professional. In control. But the tiny beads of sweat on your upper lip give you away.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Is there something else?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You didn't say 'Symington says'.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: ...I'm sorry to keep you waiting, the staff review ran over. Did you enjoy your mother's visit?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Yes. It was very good to see her.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Really? Any problems?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Not at all. She brought me my fan mail.  I had no idea there were so many strangers concerned about me. But I guess that's the best thing about working in the movies. You make so many friends. I want to go back and show them that the faith they put in me wasn't a mistake.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: You're telling me you feel guilty.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No... What I mean is... I'm just very excited by the prospect of getting on with my life, that's all.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Do you really believe your mother's trying to kill you?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: She told me you said, "Mama, you want to kill me."

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I never said... Oh look. That's just a figure of speech. She said something funny, and I said...

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: And you accused her of tampering with your mail.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Oh for Christ's...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I'm sorry. She misunderstood, that's all.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: But you tell me you had a pleasant visit and your mother says you were sullen and uncommunicative. Whom do you think I should believe?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Doctor, I hate to break this to you, but my mother is a little batty.

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Frances, you're still filled with anxiety. You feel guilty and hostile toward your family and friends. Consequently, I didn't recommend your release at the staff review.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Mental illness is an elusive thing, and though I'm pleased you're feeling more... capable, it's perhaps unrealistic to expect you to be completely cured after so short a time. Don't you agree?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: I'm sure you'll see it my way in the end.

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Dr. Symington, how big is your dick?

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Huh?

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: 'Cause if it's long enough, which I doubt, why don't you wrap it around and fuck yourself in the ass!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: I want outta here, you understand? I'm ready to get out! So you go back there... you go back and you tell them to let me out!

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Frances, I'm warning you...

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: No, I'm warning you! Who do you think you are, God? You bumble around with your folders...  ...and your pencils...  ...and your god-damn buttons...  ...all your badges of authority! But you have no authority! You're nothing! You're a zero!

turns.speaker: FRANCES
turns.text: Symington says...

turns.speaker: SYMINGTON
turns.text: Sedate her.

turns.speaker: KAMINSKI
turns.text: And do you think it's radical for a man to have a job and feed a family?

turns.speaker: YORK & CROWD
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: KAMINSKI
turns.text: Is it radical for you to have a hand in shaping your future, and the future of your children?

turns.speaker: YORK & CROWD
turns.text: No!

turns.speaker: KAMINSKI
turns.text: Is it radical for the wealth of this country to be turned back to the people who built the country?

turns.speaker: YORK & CROWD
turns.text: No! No!

turns.speaker: KAMINSKI
turns.text: Good! Because, Brothers, that's you!

turns.speaker: OLDER NURSE
turns.text: I don't know why they even bother. She's had enough of this to knock sense into a bull elephant.

turns.speaker: YOUNG NURSE
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: OLDER NURSE
turns.text: I checked the files. This one holds the record for shock treatments. Four hundred seventeen and no end in sight.

turns.speaker: YOUNG NURSE
turns.text: You're kidding.

turns.speaker: OLDER NURSE
turns.text: Yeah, well, you know doctors. They sure hate to use that word.

turns.speaker: YOUNG NURSE
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: OLDER NURSE
turns.text: 'Incurable.'
